servinfo.title: Engine Oil and Filter Change

item.ptxt: New and used engine oil can be hazardous.
Be sure to read General Precautions and observe what in written there.
Steps 1) – 11) must be performed with ENGINE NOT RUNNING. For Step 12), be sure to have adequate ventilation while engine is running.
Be sure to use specified engine oil. Using other engine oil will cause engine trouble.
Do not top up oil over FULL level mark on dipstick. Too much oil could destroy engine.

servinfo.ptxt: Before draining engine oil, check engine for oil leakage. If any evidence of leakage is found, make sure to correct defective part before proceeding to the following work.

s1.ptxt: Remove engine under cover.
Drain engine oil by removing drain plug.
After draining oil, wipe drain plug clean. Reinstall drain plug.
Loosen oil filter by using oil filter wrench (special tool) accessing from between engine mounting and radiator outlet hose and from below vehicle.
Wipe oil filter mounting surface of cylinder block cleanly.
Apply engine oil to new oil filter gasket.
Screw new filter on oil filter stand by hand until the filter gasket contacts the mounting surface.

attention2.ptxt: To tighten oil filter properly, it is important to accurately identify the position at which filter gasket first contacts the mounting surface.

s1.ptxt: Tighten oil filter (1) 3 / 4 turn from the point of contact with the mounting surface using an oil filter wrench (2).
Replenish oil until oil level is brought to FULL level mark on dipstick.
The filler inlet is at the top of the cylinder head cover.
Use only synthetic engine oil of specified grade below.
Vehicle with diesel particulate filter:
ACEA C3 or C4
Vehicle without diesel particulate filter:
ACEA C3 or B4
Select the appropriate oil viscosity according to the chart [A].
SAE 5W-30 is the best choice for good fuel economy, and good starting in cold weather.

item.ptxt: Note that the amount of oil required when actually changing oil may somewhat differ from the data depending on various conditions (temperature, viscosity, etc.)
The specified engine oil and “proper engine oil viscosity chart [A]” included in this manual are given as typical ones.
The actual engine oil and proper engine oil viscosity, however, vary depending on the vehicle specifications and such typical chart may not be applicable to some models.
Therefore, for the specific information on the engine oil and proper engine oil viscosity, refer to “Engine Oil and Filter” section of the Owner’s Manual.

s1.ptxt: Check oil filter and drain plug for oil leakage.
Install engine under cover.
Check oil level as follows.

s2.ptxt: Warm up engine to normal operating temperature.
Remove dipstick and wipe oil off it with a clean lint-free cloth.
Remove dipstick again and check oil level.
Add oil, as necessary, to bring oil level to FULL level mark (1) on dipstick.
